options.name: cluster.lookup-unhashed
options.description: This option if set to ON, does a lookup through all the sub-volumes, in case a lookup didn't return any result from the hash subvolume. If set to OFF, it does not do a lookup on the remaining subvolumes.

options.name: cluster.lookup-optimize
options.description: This option if set to ON enables the optimization of -ve lookups, by not doing a lookup on non-hashed subvolumes for files, in case the hashed subvolume does not return any result. This option disregards the lookup-unhashed setting, when enabled.

options.name: cluster.min-free-disk
options.description: Percentage/Size of disk space, after which the process starts balancing out the cluster, and logs will appear in log files

options.name: cluster.min-free-inodes
options.description: after system has only N% of inodes, warnings starts to appear in log files

options.name: cluster.rebalance-stats
options.description: This option if set to ON displays and logs the  time taken for migration of each file, during the rebalance process. If set to OFF, the rebalance logs will only display the time spent in each directory.

options.name: cluster.subvols-per-directory
options.description: Specifies the directory layout spread. Takes number of subvolumes as default value.

options.name: cluster.readdir-optimize
options.description: This option if set to ON enables the optimization that allows DHT to requests non-first subvolumes to filter out directory entries.

options.name: cluster.rebal-throttle
options.description: Sets the maximum number of parallel file migrations allowed on a node during the rebalance operation. The default value is normal and allows a max of [($(processing units) - 4) / 2), 2]  files to be migrated at a time. Lazy will allow only one file to be migrated at a time and aggressive will allow max of [($(processing units) - 4) / 2), 4]

options.name: cluster.weighted-rebalance
options.description: When enabled, files will be allocated to bricks with a probability proportional to their size.  Otherwise, all bricks will have the same probability (legacy behavior).

options.name: cluster.entry-change-log
options.description: Entry fops like create/unlink will not perform pre/post fop changelog operations in afr transaction if this option is disabled

options.name: cluster.read-subvolume
options.description: inode-read fops happen only on one of the bricks in replicate. Afr will prefer the one specified using this option if it is not stale. Option value must be one of the xlator names of the children. Ex: <volname>-client-0 till <volname>-client-<number-of-bricks - 1>

options.name: cluster.read-subvolume-index
options.description: inode-read fops happen only on one of the bricks in replicate. AFR will prefer the one specified using this option if it is not stale. allowed options include -1 till replica-count - 1

options.name: cluster.read-hash-mode
options.description: inode-read fops happen only on one of the bricks in replicate. AFR will prefer the one computed using the method specified using this option0 = first up server, 1 = hash by GFID of file (all clients use same subvolume), 2 = hash by GFID of file and client PID

options.name: cluster.background-self-heal-count
options.description: This specifies the number of per client self-heal jobs that can perform parallel heals in the background.

options.name: cluster.metadata-self-heal
options.description: Using this option we can enable/disable metadata i.e. Permissions, ownerships, xattrs self-heal on the file/directory.

options.name: cluster.data-self-heal
options.description: Using this option we can enable/disable data self-heal on the file. "open" means data self-heal action will only be triggered by file open operations.

options.name: cluster.entry-self-heal
options.description: Using this option we can enable/disable entry self-heal on the directory.

options.name: cluster.self-heal-daemon
options.description: This option applies to only self-heal-daemon. Index directory crawl and automatic healing of files will not be performed if this option is turned off.

options.name: cluster.heal-timeout
options.description: time interval for checking the need to self-heal in self-heal-daemon

options.name: cluster.self-heal-window-size
options.description: Maximum number blocks per file for which self-heal process would be applied simultaneously.

options.name: cluster.data-change-log
options.description: Data fops like write/truncate will not perform pre/post fop changelog operations in afr transaction if this option is disabled

options.name: cluster.metadata-change-log
options.description: Metadata fops like setattr/setxattr will not perform pre/post fop changelog operations in afr transaction if this option is disabled

options.name: cluster.data-self-heal-algorithm
options.description: Select between "full", "diff". The "full" algorithm copies the entire file from source to sink. The "diff" algorithm copies to sink only those blocks whose checksums don't match with those of source. If no option is configured the option is chosen dynamically as follows: If the file does not exist on one of the sinks or empty file exists or if the source file size is about the same as page size the entire file will be read and written i.e "full" algo, otherwise "diff" algo is chosen.

options.name: cluster.eager-lock
options.description: Lock phase of a transaction has two sub-phases. First is an attempt to acquire locks in parallel by broadcasting non-blocking lock requests. If lock acquisition fails on any server, then the held locks are unlocked and revert to a blocking locked mode sequentially on one server after another.  If this option is enabled the initial broadcasting lock request attempt to acquire lock on the entire file. If this fails, we revert back to the sequential "regional" blocking lock as before. In the case where such an "eager" lock is granted in the non-blocking phase, it gives rise to an opportunity for optimization. i.e, if the next write transaction on the same FD arrives before the unlock phase of the first transaction, it "takes over" the full file lock. Similarly if yet another data transaction arrives before the unlock phase of the "optimized" transaction, that in turn "takes over" the lock as well. The actual unlock now happens at the end of the last "optimized" transaction.

options.name: disperse.eager-lock
options.description: This option will enable/diable eager lock fordisperse volume

options.name: cluster.quorum-type
options.description: If value is "fixed" only allow writes if quorum-count bricks are present.  If value is "auto" only allow writes if more than half of bricks, or exactly half including the first, are present.

options.name: cluster.quorum-count
options.description: If quorum-type is "fixed" only allow writes if this many bricks or present.  Other quorum types will OVERWRITE this value.

options.name: cluster.choose-local
options.description: Choose a local subvolume (i.e. Brick) to read from if read-subvolume is not explicitly set.

options.name: cluster.self-heal-readdir-size
options.description: readdirp size for performing entry self-heal

options.name: cluster.ensure-durability
options.description: Afr performs fsyncs for transactions if this option is on to make sure the changelogs/data is written to the disk

options.name: cluster.consistent-metadata
options.description: If this option is enabled, readdirp will force lookups on those entries read whose read child is not the same as that of the parent. This will guarantee that all read operations on a file serve attributes from the same subvol as long as it holds  a good copy of the file/dir.

options.name: cluster.heal-wait-queue-length
options.description: This specifies the number of heals that can be queued for the parallel background self heal jobs.

options.name: cluster.stripe-block-size
options.description: Size of the stripe unit that would be read from or written to the striped servers.

options.name: cluster.stripe-coalesce
options.description: Enable/Disable coalesce mode to flatten striped files as stored on the server (i.e., eliminate holes caused by the traditional format).

options.name: diagnostics.latency-measurement
options.description: If on stats related to the latency of each operation would be tracked inside GlusterFS data-structures.

options.name: diagnostics.dump-fd-stats
options.description: If on stats related to file-operations would be tracked inside GlusterFS data-structures.

options.name: diagnostics.brick-log-level
options.description: Changes the log-level of the bricks

options.name: diagnostics.client-log-level
options.description: Changes the log-level of the clients

options.name: diagnostics.brick-sys-log-level
options.description: Gluster's syslog log-level

options.name: diagnostics.client-sys-log-level
options.description: Gluster's syslog log-level

options.name: diagnostics.brick-logger
options.description: (null)

options.name: diagnostics.client-logger
options.description: (null)

options.name: diagnostics.brick-log-format
options.description: (null)

options.name: diagnostics.client-log-format
options.description: (null)

options.name: diagnostics.brick-log-buf-size
options.description: (null)

options.name: diagnostics.client-log-buf-size
options.description: (null)

options.name: diagnostics.brick-log-flush-timeout
options.description: (null)

options.name: diagnostics.client-log-flush-timeout
options.description: (null)

options.name: performance.cache-max-file-size
options.description: Maximum file size which would be cached by the io-cache translator.

options.name: performance.cache-min-file-size
options.description: Minimum file size which would be cached by the io-cache translator.

options.name: performance.cache-refresh-timeout
options.description: The cached data for a file will be retained till 'cache-refresh-timeout' seconds, after which data re-validation is performed.

options.name: performance.cache-priority
options.description: Assigns priority to filenames with specific patterns so that when a page needs to be ejected out of the cache, the page of a file whose priority is the lowest will be ejected earlier

options.name: performance.cache-size
options.description: Size of the read cache.

options.name: performance.io-thread-count
options.description: Number of threads in IO threads translator which perform concurrent IO operations

options.name: performance.high-prio-threads
options.description: Max number of threads in IO threads translator which perform high priority IO operations at a given time

options.name: performance.normal-prio-threads
options.description: Max number of threads in IO threads translator which perform normal priority IO operations at a given time

options.name: performance.low-prio-threads
options.description: Max number of threads in IO threads translator which perform low priority IO operations at a given time

options.name: performance.least-prio-threads
options.description: Max number of threads in IO threads translator which perform least priority IO operations at a given time

options.name: performance.enable-least-priority
options.description: Enable/Disable least priority

options.name: performance.least-rate-limit
options.description: Max number of least priority operations to handle per-second

options.name: performance.flush-behind
options.description: If this option is set ON, instructs write-behind translator to perform flush in background, by returning success (or any errors, if any of previous  writes were failed) to application even before flush FOP is sent to backend filesystem.

options.name: performance.nfs.flush-behind
options.description: If this option is set ON, instructs write-behind translator to perform flush in background, by returning success (or any errors, if any of previous  writes were failed) to application even before flush FOP is sent to backend filesystem.

options.name: performance.write-behind-window-size
options.description: Size of the write-behind buffer for a single file (inode).

options.name: performance.resync-failed-syncs-after-fsync
options.description: If sync of "cached-writes issued before fsync" (to backend) fails, this option configures whether to retry syncing them after fsync or forget them. If set to on, cached-writes are retried till a "flush" fop (or a successful sync) on sync failures. fsync itself is failed irrespective of the value of this option.

options.name: performance.nfs.write-behind-window-size
options.description: Size of the write-behind buffer for a single file (inode).

options.name: performance.strict-o-direct
options.description: This option when set to off, ignores the O_DIRECT flag.

options.name: performance.nfs.strict-o-direct
options.description: This option when set to off, ignores the O_DIRECT flag.

options.name: performance.strict-write-ordering
options.description: Do not let later writes overtake earlier writes even if they do not overlap

options.name: performance.nfs.strict-write-ordering
options.description: Do not let later writes overtake earlier writes even if they do not overlap

options.name: performance.lazy-open
options.description: Perform open in the backend only when a necessary FOP arrives (e.g writev on the FD, unlink of the file). When option is disabled, perform backend open right after unwinding open().

options.name: performance.read-after-open
options.description: read is sent only after actual open happens and real fd is obtained, instead of doing on anonymous fd (similar to write)

options.name: performance.read-ahead-page-count
options.description: Number of pages that will be pre-fetched

options.name: performance.md-cache-timeout
options.description: Time period after which cache has to be refreshed

options.name: performance.cache-swift-metadata
options.description: Cache swift metadata (user.swift.metadata xattr)

options.name: features.encryption
options.description: enable/disable client-side encryption for the volume.

options.name: encryption.master-key
options.description: Pathname of regular file which contains master volume key

options.name: encryption.data-key-size
options.description: Data key size (bits)

options.name: encryption.block-size
options.description: Atom size (bits)

options.name: network.frame-timeout
options.description: Time frame after which the (file) operation would be declared as dead, if the server does not respond for a particular (file) operation.

options.name: network.ping-timeout
options.description: Time duration for which the client waits to check if the server is responsive.

options.name: network.tcp-window-size
options.description: Specifies the window size for tcp socket.

options.name: features.lock-heal
options.description: When the connection to client is lost, server cleans up all the locks held by the client. After the connection is restored, the client reacquires (heals) the fcntl locks released by the server.

options.name: features.grace-timeout
options.description: Specifies the duration for the lock state to be maintained on the client after a network disconnection. Range 10-1800 seconds.

options.name: network.remote-dio
options.description: If enabled, in open() and creat() calls, O_DIRECT flag will be filtered at the client protocol level so server will still continue to cache the file. This works similar to NFS's behavior of O_DIRECT

options.name: client.event-threads
options.description: Specifies the number of event threads to execute in parallel. Larger values would help process responses faster, depending on available processing power. Range 1-32 threads.

options.name: network.ping-timeout
options.description: (null)

options.name: network.inode-lru-limit
options.description: Specifies the maximum megabytes of memory to be used in the inode cache.

options.name: auth.allow
options.description: Allow a comma separated list of addresses and/or hostnames to connect to the server. Option auth.reject overrides this option. By default, all connections are allowed.

options.name: auth.reject
options.description: Reject a comma separated list of addresses and/or hostnames to connect to the server. This option overrides the auth.allow option. By default, all connections are allowed.

options.name: server.root-squash
options.description: Map requests from uid/gid 0 to the anonymous uid/gid. Note that this does not apply to any other uids or gids that might be equally sensitive, such as user bin or group staff.

options.name: server.anonuid
options.description: value of the uid used for the anonymous user/nfsnobody when root-squash is enabled.

options.name: server.anongid
options.description: value of the gid used for the anonymous user/nfsnobody when root-squash is enabled.

options.name: server.statedump-path
options.description: Specifies directory in which gluster should save its statedumps.

options.name: server.outstanding-rpc-limit
options.description: Parameter to throttle the number of incoming RPC requests from a client. 0 means no limit (can potentially run out of memory)

options.name: server.manage-gids
options.description: Resolve groups on the server-side.

options.name: server.dynamic-auth
options.description: When 'on' perform dynamic authentication of volume options in order to allow/terminate client transport connection immediately in response to *.allow | *.reject volume set options.

options.name: server.gid-timeout
options.description: Timeout in seconds for the cached groups to expire.

options.name: server.event-threads
options.description: Specifies the number of event threads to execute in parallel. Larger values would help process responses faster, depending on available processing power. Range 1-32 threads.

options.name: ssl.own-cert
options.description: SSL certificate. Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: ssl.private-key
options.description: SSL private key. Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: ssl.ca-list
options.description: SSL CA list. Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: ssl.crl-path
options.description: Path to directory containing CRL. Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: ssl.certificate-depth
options.description: Maximum certificate-chain depth.  If zero, the peer's certificate itself must be in the local certificate list.  Otherwise, there may be up to N signing certificates between the peer's and the local list.  Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: ssl.cipher-list
options.description: Allowed SSL ciphers. Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: ssl.dh-param
options.description: DH parameters file. Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: ssl.ec-curve
options.description: ECDH curve name. Ignored if SSL is not enabled.

options.name: performance.write-behind
options.description: enable/disable write-behind translator in the volume.

options.name: performance.read-ahead
options.description: enable/disable read-ahead translator in the volume.

options.name: performance.readdir-ahead
options.description: enable/disable readdir-ahead translator in the volume.

options.name: performance.io-cache
options.description: enable/disable io-cache translator in the volume.

options.name: performance.quick-read
options.description: enable/disable quick-read translator in the volume.

options.name: performance.open-behind
options.description: enable/disable open-behind translator in the volume.

options.name: performance.stat-prefetch
options.description: enable/disable meta-data caching translator in the volume.

options.name: performance.client-io-threads
options.description: enable/disable io-threads translator in the client graph of volume.

options.name: performance.nfs.write-behind
options.description: enable/disable write-behind translator in the volume

options.name: performance.force-readdirp
options.description: Convert all readdir requests to readdirplus to collect stat info on each entry.

options.name: features.file-snapshot
options.description: enable/disable file-snapshot feature in the volume.

options.name: features.uss
options.description: enable/disable User Serviceable Snapshots on the volume.

options.name: features.snapshot-directory
options.description: Entry point directory for entering snapshot world. Value can have only [0-9a-z-_] and starts with dot (.) and cannot exceed 255 character

options.name: features.show-snapshot-directory
options.description: show entry point in readdir output of snapdir-entry-path which is set by samba

options.name: network.compression
options.description: enable/disable network compression translator

options.name: network.compression.window-size
options.description: Size of the zlib history buffer.

options.name: network.compression.mem-level
options.description: Memory allocated for internal compression state. 1 uses minimum memory but is slow and reduces compression ratio; memLevel=9 uses maximum memory for optimal speed. The default value is 8.

options.name: network.compression.min-size
options.description: Data is compressed only when its size exceeds this.

options.name: network.compression.compression-level
options.description:
Compression levels 
0 : no compression, 1 : best speed, 
9 : best compression, -1 : default compression

options.name: features.quota-deem-statfs
options.description: If set to on, it takes quota limits intoconsideration while estimating fs size. (df command) (Default is off).

options.name: nfs.enable-ino32
options.description: For nfs clients or apps that do not support 64-bit inode numbers, use this option to make NFS return 32-bit inode numbers instead. Disabled by default, so NFS returns 64-bit inode numbers.

options.name: nfs.mem-factor
options.description: Use this option to make NFS be faster on systems by using more memory. This option specifies a multiple that determines the total amount of memory used. Default value is 15. Increase to use more memory in order to improve performance for certain use cases.Please consult gluster-users list before using this option.

options.name: nfs.export-dirs
options.description: By default, all subvolumes of nfs are exported as individual exports. There are cases where a subdirectory or subdirectories in the volume need to be exported separately. Enabling this option allows any directory on a volumes to be exported separately.Directory exports are enabled by default.

options.name: nfs.export-volumes
options.description: Enable or disable exporting whole volumes, instead if used in conjunction with nfs3.export-dir, can allow setting up only subdirectories as exports. On by default.

options.name: nfs.addr-namelookup
options.description: Users have the option of turning on name lookup for incoming client connections using this option. Use this option to turn on name lookups during address-based authentication. Turning this on will enable you to use hostnames in nfs.rpc-auth-* filters. In some setups, the name server can take too long to reply to DNS queries resulting in timeouts of mount requests. By default, name lookup is off

options.name: nfs.dynamic-volumes
options.description: Internal option set to tell gnfs to use a different scheme for encoding file handles when DVM is being used.

options.name: nfs.register-with-portmap
options.description: For systems that need to run multiple nfs servers, only one registration is possible with portmap service. Use this option to turn off portmap registration for Gluster NFS. On by default

options.name: nfs.outstanding-rpc-limit
options.description: Parameter to throttle the number of incoming RPC requests from a client. 0 means no limit (can potentially run out of memory)

options.name: nfs.port
options.description: Use this option on systems that need Gluster NFS to be associated with a non-default port number.

options.name: nfs.rpc-auth-unix
options.description: Disable or enable the AUTH_UNIX authentication type for a particular exported volume overriding defaults and general setting for AUTH_UNIX scheme. Must always be enabled for better interoperability. However, can be disabled if needed. Enabled by default.

options.name: nfs.rpc-auth-null
options.description: Disable or enable the AUTH_NULL authentication type for a particular exported volume overriding defaults and general setting for AUTH_NULL. Must always be enabled. This option is here only to avoid unrecognized option warnings.

options.name: nfs.rpc-auth-allow
options.description: Allow a comma separated list of addresses and/or hostnames to connect to the server. By default, all connections are allowed. This allows users to define a rule for a specific exported volume.

options.name: nfs.rpc-auth-reject
options.description: Reject a comma separated list of addresses and/or hostnames from connecting to the server. By default, all connections are allowed. This allows users to define a rule for a specific exported volume.

options.name: nfs.ports-insecure
options.description: Allow client connections from unprivileged ports. By default only privileged ports are allowed. Use this option to enable or disable insecure ports for a specific subvolume and to override the global setting set by the previous option.

options.name: nfs.transport-type
options.description: Specifies the nfs transport type. Valid transport types are 'tcp' and 'rdma'.

options.name: nfs.trusted-sync
options.description: All writes and COMMIT requests are treated as async. This implies that no write requests are guaranteed to be on server disks when the write reply is received at the NFS client. Trusted sync includes  trusted-write behaviour. Off by default.

options.name: nfs.trusted-write
options.description: On an UNSTABLE write from client, return STABLE flag to force client to not send a COMMIT request. In some environments, combined with a replicated GlusterFS setup, this option can improve write performance. This flag allows user to trust Gluster replication logic to sync data to the disks and recover when required. COMMIT requests if received will be handled in a default manner by fsyncing. STABLE writes are still handled in a sync manner. Off by default.

options.name: nfs.volume-access
options.description: Type of access desired for this subvolume:  read-only, read-write(default)

options.name: nfs.export-dir
options.description: By default, all subvolumes of nfs are exported as individual exports. There are cases where a subdirectory or subdirectories in the volume need to be exported separately. This option can also be used in conjunction with nfs3.export-volumes option to restrict exports only to the subdirectories specified through this option. Must be an absolute path. Along with path allowed list of IPs/hostname can be associated with each subdirectory. If provided connection will allowed only from these IPs. By default connections from all IPs are allowed. Format: <dir>[(hostspec[|hostspec|...])][,...]. Where hostspec can be an IP address, hostname or an IP range in CIDR notation. e.g. /foo(192.168.1.0/24|host1|10.1.1.8),/host2. NOTE: Care must be taken while configuring this option as invalid entries and/or unreachable DNS servers can introduce unwanted delay in all the mount calls.

options.name: nfs.disable
options.description: This option is used to start or stop the NFS server for individual volumes.

options.name: nfs.nlm
options.description: This option, if set to 'off', disables NLM server by not registering the service with the portmapper. Set it to 'on' to re-enable it. Default value: 'on'

options.name: nfs.acl
options.description: This option is used to control ACL support for NFS.

options.name: nfs.mount-udp
options.description: set the option to 'on' to enable mountd on UDP. Required for some Solaris and AIX NFS clients. The need for enabling this option often depends on the usage of NLM.

options.name: nfs.mount-rmtab
options.description: Set the location of the cache file that is used to list all the NFS-clients that have connected through the MOUNT protocol. If this is on shared storage, all GlusterFS servers will update and output (with 'showmount') the same list. Set to "/-" to disable.

options.name: nfs.drc
options.description: Enable Duplicate Request Cache in gNFS server to improve correctness of non-idempotent operations like write, delete, link, et al

options.name: nfs.drc-size
options.description: Sets the number of non-idempotent requests to cache in drc

options.name: nfs.read-size
options.description: Size in which the client should issue read requests to the Gluster NFSv3 server. Must be a multiple of 4KB (4096). Min and Max supported values are 4KB (4096) and 1MB (1048576) respectively. If the specified value is within the supported range but not a multiple of 4096, it is rounded up to the nearest multiple of 4096.

options.name: nfs.write-size
options.description: Size in which the client should issue write requests to the Gluster NFSv3 server. Must be a multiple of 1KB (1024). Min and Max supported values are 4KB (4096) and 1MB(1048576) respectively. If the specified value is within the supported range but not a multiple of 4096, it is rounded up to the nearest multiple of 4096.

options.name: nfs.readdir-size
options.description: Size in which the client should issue directory reading requests to the Gluster NFSv3 server. Must be a multiple of 1KB (1024). Min and Max supported values are 4KB (4096) and 1MB (1048576) respectively.If the specified value is within the supported range but not a multiple of 4096, it is rounded up to the nearest multiple of 4096.

options.name: nfs.exports-auth-enable
options.description: Set the option to 'on' to enable exports/netgroup authentication in the NFS server and mount daemon.

options.name: nfs.auth-refresh-interval-sec
options.description: Frequency in seconds that the daemon should check for changes in the exports/netgroups file.

options.name: nfs.auth-cache-ttl-sec
options.description: Sets the TTL of an entry in the auth cache. Value is in seconds.

options.name: features.read-only
options.description: When "on", makes a volume read-only. It is turned "off" by default.

options.name: features.worm
options.description: When "on", makes a volume get write once read many  feature. It is turned "off" by default.

options.name: storage.linux-aio
options.description: Support for native Linux AIO

options.name: storage.batch-fsync-mode
options.description:
Possible values:
	- syncfs: Perform one syncfs() on behalf oa batchof fsyncs.
	- syncfs-single-fsync: Perform one syncfs() on behalf of a batch of fsyncs and one fsync() per batch.
	- syncfs-reverse-fsync: Preform one syncfs() on behalf of a batch of fsyncs and fsync() each file in the batch in reverse order.
 in reverse order.
	- reverse-fsync: Perform fsync() of each file in the batch in reverse order.

options.name: storage.batch-fsync-delay-usec
options.description: Num of usecs to wait for aggregating fsync requests

options.name: storage.owner-uid
options.description: Support for setting uid of brick's owner

options.name: storage.owner-gid
options.description: Support for setting gid of brick's owner

options.name: storage.node-uuid-pathinfo
options.description: return glusterd's node-uuid in pathinfo xattr string instead of hostname

options.name: storage.health-check-interval
options.description: Interval in seconds for a filesystem health check, set to 0 to disable

options.name: storage.build-pgfid
options.description: Enable placeholders for gfid to path conversion

options.name: storage.bd-aio
options.description: Support for native Linux AIO

options.name: cluster.server-quorum-type
options.description: This feature is on the server-side i.e. in glusterd. Whenever the glusterd on a machine observes that the quorum is not met, it brings down the bricks to prevent data split-brains. When the network connections are brought back up and the quorum is restored the bricks in the volume are brought back up.

options.name: cluster.server-quorum-ratio
options.description: Sets the quorum percentage for the trusted storage pool.

options.name: changelog.changelog-barrier-timeout
options.description: After 'timeout' seconds since the time 'barrier' option was set to "on", unlink/rmdir/rename  operations are no longer blocked and previously blocked fops are allowed to go through

options.name: features.barrier-timeout
options.description: After 'timeout' seconds since the time 'barrier' option was set to "on", acknowledgements to file operations are no longer blocked and previously blocked acknowledgements are sent to the application

options.name: features.trash
options.description: Enable/disable trash translator

options.name: features.trash-dir
options.description: Directory for trash files

options.name: features.trash-eliminate-path
options.description: Eliminate paths to be excluded from trashing

options.name: features.trash-max-filesize
options.description: Maximum size of file that can be moved to trash

options.name: features.trash-internal-op
options.description: Enable/disable trash translator for internal operations

options.name: cluster.enable-shared-storage
options.description: Create and mount the shared storage volume(gluster_shared_storage) at /var/run/gluster/shared_storage on enabling this option. Unmount and delete the shared storage volume  on disabling this option.

options.name: cluster.write-freq-threshold
options.description: Defines the number of writes, in a promotion/demotion cycle, that would mark a file HOT for promotion. Any file that has write hits less than this value will be considered as COLD and will be demoted.

options.name: cluster.read-freq-threshold
options.description: Defines the number of reads, in a promotion/demotion cycle, that would mark a file HOT for promotion. Any file that has read hits less than this value will be considered as COLD and will be demoted.

options.name: cluster.tier-pause
options.description: (null)

options.name: cluster.tier-promote-frequency
options.description: Frequency to promote files to fast tier

options.name: cluster.tier-demote-frequency
options.description: Frequency to demote files to slow tier

options.name: cluster.watermark-hi
options.description: Upper % watermark for promotion. If hot tier fills above this percentage, no promotion will happen and demotion will happen with high probability.

options.name: cluster.watermark-low
options.description: Lower % watermark. If hot tier is less full than this, promotion will happen and demotion will not happen. If greater than this, promotion/demotion will happen at a probability relative to how full the hot tier is.

options.name: cluster.tier-mode
options.description: Either 'test' or 'cache'. Test mode periodically demotes or promotes files automatically based on access. Cache mode does so based on whether the cache is full or not, as specified with watermarks.

options.name: cluster.tier-max-mb
options.description: The maximum number of MB that may be migrated in any direction in a given cycle by a single node.

options.name: cluster.tier-max-files
options.description: The maximum number of files that may be migrated in any direction in a given cycle by a single node.

options.name: features.ctr-enabled
options.description: Enable CTR xlator

options.name: features.record-counters
options.description: Its a Change Time Recorder Xlator option to enable recording write and read heat counters. The default is disabled. If enabled, "cluster.write-freq-threshold" and "cluster.read-freq-threshold" defined the number of writes (or reads) to a given file are needed before triggering migration.

options.name: features.ctr-sql-db-cachesize
options.description: Defines the cache size of the sqlite database of changetimerecorder xlator.The input to this option is in pages.Each page is 4096 bytes. Default value is 1000 pages i.e ~ 4 MB. The max value is 262144 pages i.e 1 GB and the min value is 1000 pages i.e ~ 4 MB.

options.name: features.ctr-sql-db-wal-autocheckpoint
options.description: Defines the autocheckpoint of the sqlite database of  changetimerecorder. The input to this option is in pages. Each page is 4096 bytes. Default value is 1000 pages i.e ~ 4 MB.The max value is 262144 pages i.e 1 GB and the min value is 1000 pages i.e ~4 MB.

options.name: cluster.quorum-reads
options.description: If quorum-reads is "true" only allow reads if quorum is met when quorum is enabled.

options.name: ganesha.enable
options.description: export volume via NFS-Ganesha

options.name: features.shard
options.description: enable/disable sharding translator on the volume.

options.name: features.shard-block-size
options.description: The size unit used to break a file into multiple chunks

options.name: features.cache-invalidation
options.description: When "on", sends cache-invalidation notifications.

options.name: features.cache-invalidation-timeout
options.description: After 'timeout' seconds since the time client accessed any file, cache-invalidation notifications are no longer sent to that client.

options.name: disperse.background-heals
options.description: This option can be used to control number of parallel heals

options.name: disperse.heal-wait-qlength
options.description: This option can be used to control number of heals that can wait

options.name: dht.force-readdirp
options.description: This option if set to ON, forces the use of readdirp, and hence also displays the stats of the files.

options.name: disperse.read-policy
options.description: inode-read fops happen only on 'k' number of bricks in n=k+m disperse subvolume. 'round-robin' selects the read subvolume using round-robin algo. 'gfid-hash' selects read subvolume based on hash of the gfid of that file/directory.
